item.title: Amazon Raised Its Fire TV Prices, but Hisense’s 43″ Smart Fire TV Is Still at a Steal to Clear Out Stock
item.content:encoded:
We’re now a few days past Amazon’s made up holiday of Prime Big Deals Days. They invented it so we would all have a good reason to buy a bunch of stuff in the sales drought the exists between Labor Day and Black Friday. If you had let this October 7 and October 8 sale pass on by having not grabbed anything for yourself, you’re not out of luck just yet. Amazon still has a number of live deals in which you can save boatloads on cool stuff. Take this Hisense TV for example. The 43-inch model already starts at an affordable price of $350. However, during this limited time deal, It’s come down by 31%. That means you only have a pay a measly $250.

Hisense is one of those brands that is hands down the best option for your depending on your priorities. This isn’t some expensive OLED TV which can go for multiple thousands of dollars. You can still get a picture that big, displays and 4K, and has a wide color gamut without taking out a second mortgage on your house. This 4K 43-inch TV has support for Dolby Vision and Dolby Atmos which can enhance your image quality and sound even further.

See at Amazon

When it comes to video games, the Hisense smart TV employs Game Mode Plus. This allows you to play games with the picture settings prioritizing what matter for gaming. The variable refresh rate and auto low latency mode will reduce input lag so you player character feels snappy and responsive on screen. Otherwise playing on a screen with bad response times can make it feel like you’re moving your guy through mud.

Fire TV and Alexa-enabled

This Hisense Smart TV is designed with the Fire TV interface. Download all the streaming apps from Netflix to Disney Plus to Hulu to HBO Max (if that’s what they’re still calling it by the time this gets published).

The remote is built with Alexa voice support. You can just hold the button down and speak into it the title of the movie or TV show you’re looking to watch. It’s much easier to just say “The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford,” than it is to type out all of that one letter at a time on those on-screen keypads.

For a limited time, you can pick up this Hisense 4K 43-inch television for an all-time low price of just $250.

item.title: Amazon’s Letting the DJI Mini 3 Fly More Drone Combo Go for Prime Day Low to Empty the Warehouse
item.content:encoded:
A smart way to seriously level up your aerial photography and filming game is by grabbing a solid drone camera. The DJI Mini 3 Fly More Combo with DJI RC does a great job at that, and you can get your hands on this feature-packed bundle for less right now.

Amazon has dropped the price by 20%, bringing it down to $575. That’s almost $150 in savings, and you’re quite literally getting everything you need to start – three intelligent flight batteries, a dedicated controller with a built-in screen, a two-way charging hub, a shoulder bag, and more.

See at Amazon

4K HDR Recording, Plus a Solid Battery Life

This is a lightweight drone, so it’s easy to carry around in the wild. It records in 4K HDR and supports Dual Native ISO, which means excellent visuals are a given, whether you’re shooting on a bright, sunny day or in the shadows. You can shoot vertically just as well, so it’s also great if you like sharing your stuff on social media and don’t want to bother with editing or cropping. Wind resistance pushes up to 38kph (Level 5), and there’s a 3-axis mechanical gimbal to let you shoot even with the breeze.

You will also be able to explore properly. This is made possible with the 10km max video transmission range that displays a live HD feed with minimal lag on the DJI RC’s built-in 5.5-inch HD screen, regardless of the distance. Then there are a bunch of handy features that make shooting less stressful. For instance, QuickShots take care of camera movements with built-in preset patterns; no need to worry about manual controls.

Of course, there’s nothing more frustrating than an almost-dead battery high up in the air. Here, you’re looking at up to 114 minutes of total flight time with the three included intelligent batteries. Larger areas and longer shoots won’t really be an issue. And since you’re also getting a two-way charging hub thrown in with your purchase, it’s going to be easy to juice everything back up between flights.

Those using a drone camera for the first time will appreciate features like Auto Takeoff, GPS Return to Home, and Precise Hovering. All of this makes it quite easy to get started confidently.

All in all, this Fly More Combo packs a lot of value for the price. This deal lets you snag it for 20% less than the retail price, but it won’t last too long.

item.title: Amazon Is Offloading 50 Random Pokemon Cards at 50% Off, Now Selling for Mere Pennies
item.content:encoded:
Getting kids started with Pokemon card collecting can get expensive fast when you’re buying individual booster packs at the store for $5 to $7 each with only 10 cards inside. Building up enough cards to actually trade with friends or organize by type requires buying multiple packs and suddenly you’ve dropped $50 without even getting any rare cards.

Amazon just slashed the price on their 50-card Pokemon bundle from $10 down to just $5, which works out to 10 cents per card. This is the perfect starter pack for kids beginning their collection and (smart) parents are ordering four or five bundles at once to give their kids a substantial trading base right from the start.

See at Amazon

Random Pokemon Cards

The set includes 50 cards randomly selected from all Pokemon series from the old beginning of the card game in the original 1999 base set to the new releases. The set will comprise a variety of Pokemon character cards with some old favorites like Pikachu and Charizard to new generations kids are accustomed to from existing games and television programs. The set includes Energy cards too which are required to play the game as opposed to collecting the cards.

The random nature of the selection makes each package different and builds anticipation as you open the package because you never quite know what you’ll be receiving. This element of mystery replicates the booster pack buying experience at the market but you’ll be receiving five times the number of cards for the same cost. The randomness keeps kids getting Pokemon from various evolutionary levels, types, and power levels to introduce them to the depth of the Pokemon universe as opposed to receiving multiple copies of the same handful of characters.

Duplicates happen within one set or across sets if you buy a bunch of sets at one time. This is actually a benefit rather than a flaw for children assembling collections, since replicas become desirable trade material. When your kid has two or three of the same card, they can trade the spares with others who need that particular Pokemon to fill out their set or construct a superior deck. Learn the value of negotiation, social interaction, and value exchange within the context of something enjoyable, not educational.

Each of the Pokemon cards features the character’s hit points (HP), attacks with costs in energies along with values of damage, weaknesses, resistances, and retreat costs. The cards with energies show the single type with the Pokemon energies that the children recognize. The cards are the same size, girth and quality as cards found in booster packs that can be purchased at retailers.

Buying four or five bundles makes economic sense because 50 cards is actually the beginning of a serious collection. Buying four or five bundles puts kids right out of the gate with 200 to 250 cards that instantly put together a substantial-looking collection. They can then construct dozens of finished decks with different Pokemon types, a slew of duplicates with which to trade, yet still retain a display collection of their very favorites. At $5 per pack, buying five packs still costs a grand total of $25, the same as buying five single booster packs at the store that would net you the same 50 cards anyway.

For $5 rather than $10, this is the cheapest Amazon has ever sold this set at.

item.title: This 4.5-Star Gaming Mini PC (Ryzen 9, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD) Drops to All-Time Low After Staying Full Price During Prime Day
item.content:encoded:
This past week, Amazon ran its seasonal Prime Day-adjacent sales event. The October one has been given the clumsy name Prime Big Deals Days, but don’t let that fool you. The deals were quite good, but unfortunately the event has come to a close. If you missed out on grabbing yourself something cool at a discount, no need to worry. There are still a number of excellent deals happening right now despite the sales event being over. Like at this moment, this GMKtec mini gaming PC has been cut down in price by 25%. The mini PC normally goes for $800, but the deal has knocked off a clean $200. That brings the price you pay down to just $600 for a limited time.

The magic of as mini PC is right in the name. It’s miniature. This gaming PC will take up hardly any room on your desk, if not none at all. you can always mount it to the back of your monitor to maintain a completely clutter-free desktop.

See at Amazon

Spec Deep Dive

What we’re working with here is an AMD Ryzen 9 processor featuring 8 cores and 16 threads that can boost up to 5.4GHz. It’s an ideal workstation for content creation with video and photo editing software or as the main place you play your games. It’s got 32GB of DDR5 memory along with a full 1TB on its PCIe 4.0 SSD. Both can be expanded if necessary. Bring your RAM up to 128GB and the dual PCIe Gen4 x4 SSD slots can support up to 8TB total.

You can achieve even better graphical performance than as is standard here when using the Oculink port. Connect a separate GPU externally so you can achieve better frame rates and lower lag. You can also expect better performance when working in demanding software like Adobe Premiere of After Effects.

You can connect this mini PC to up to four screens at once. Simultaneous 4K display output is possible thanks to the HDMI 2.1, DisplayPort 2.1, and two USB4 slots. Achieve 4K resolutions at 60Hz over the HDMI or DisplayPort. The USB4 slots can also handle data transfer at up to 40Gb/s.

The mini PC has support for Bluetooth 5.2 so you can connect all your necessary peripherals like a gaming controller or headphones. The Wi-Fi 6 support will ensure you maintain a fast connection to the internet for online matches when on a Wi-Fi 6 network.

Keep your PC cool with the help the upgraded dual fans. They allow for 360-degrees of airflow both in and out of the unit, while keeping noise down at just 35db in quiet mode.
